intro: Truellum, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ranunculaceae. It consists of several species native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are characterized by their basal leaves that are typically palmately lobed or deeply divided. Truellum species produce small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish or white in color. These plants are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
